law.catch_line: Deposit With Treasurer Of The Commonwealth
law.text: DEPOSIT WITH TREASURER OF THE COMMONWEALTH Assets of a dissolved corporation that should be transferred to a creditor, claimant, or shareholder of the corporation who cannot be found or who is not competent to receive them shall be reduced to cash and deposited with the treasurer of the commonwealth or other appropriate official of the commonwealth for safekeeping. When the creditor, claimant, or shareholder furnishes satisfactory proof of entitlement to the amount deposited, the treasurer or other appropriate official of the commonwealth shall pay him or his representative that amount.
